reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Global Research on Child Labor Measurement and Policy Development (MAP)

description.narrative: Advocacy for international labour standards, labour law, fundamental principles and rights at work (child labour, forced labour, non-discrimination in the workplace, freedom of association and collective bargaining); formalisation of informal work, occupational safety and health.

This award supports advocacy for international labor standards, labor law, fundamental principles and rights at work. More specifically, this includes To collect and analyze data on working children in at least 10 countries, including Armenia, El Salvador, Ethiopia, Georgia, Jamaica, Malawi, Morocco, Peru, Tanzania..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Labor Affairs/Office of Child Labor, Forced Labor, and Human Trafficking

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Quarterly disbursements by project. May include disbursements for: salary and benefits, travel and per diem, logistical expenses and other costs of delivering technical assistance.

sector.narrative: Labor Policies and Markets
Public sector policy and administrative management
